newsitem.title: ITALY: Marzotto says Q1 net profit 23.7 bln lire.
newsitem.headline: Marzotto says Q1 net profit 23.7 bln lire.

text.p: Italian textile group Marzotto, which announced on Saturday that it had called off a merger with industrial holding HPI, said its first-quarter consolidated net profit rose to 29.4 billion lire ($17.22 million) from 23.7 billion lire.
Operating profit was 112.4 billion, up from 103 billion but turnover dipped to 701 billion from 704.8 billion because of the appreciation of the lira, the company said in a statement.
It noted, however, that the results could not be extrapolated to indicate the full year's performance because of the seasonal nature of textile company profits.
Marzotto and HPI said in a joint statement that the merger had been called off because of insurmountable differences. ($1=1707 Lire)
